properties.name: A Little Slice of Heaven in Austin
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc1220 S. Congress Ave., Austin, Texas 78704We were housed here for our fabulous night in Austin. It was so easy to stay that we had a hard time leaving. Next time we will stay in the room overlooking the pool and I am sure that it will be even harder to leave.

properties.name: Andrew's apartment in D.C.
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc2400 16th Street NW 20009My white box of a home in the world\'s grumpiest city.

properties.name: Andrew's favorite cactus in Arizona
properties.description: Posted by AndrewdcThe amazing saguaros of Arizona. Just like in road-runner cartoons! Can\'t help thinking they\'re full of something delicious, like giant prickly watermellons...

properties.name: Andrew's old house in West Seattle
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc4117 42nd Ave SW 98116

properties.name: Beach House at Outer Banks
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc  kitty hawk north carolinaSummer 2004

properties.name: Capital Q
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc 707 H Street Northwest, Washington, DC, 20001Capital Q 202202-347347-83968397

properties.name: DC's Fish Market
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc3933 South Capitol Street Southwest, Washington, DC, 20032We got raw materials for sushi here, but there were no fish being thrown. It could take some cues from Seattle but I suppose it\'s worth remembering that DC is actually pretty far from the ocean.

properties.name: Den of Deliciousity
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc1790 Columbia Rd. NW, washington dcThe best Italian food outside of Andrew\'s kitchen. Nice small place with delicious wine- always worth the wait and the walk. You might even glimpse Mama Pasta herself if you stay late.

properties.name: El Khartoum
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc1782 Florida Ave. NW Washington DC 20009 The least pretentious restaurant in DC with great food.

properties.name: Exotic vines in Tennesee
properties.description: Posted by AndrewdcLush, greeny goodness outside of Knoxville, Tennesee.

properties.name: Feliz's DC Basement
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc1823 kalorama 20009This is the place that Feliz lived when Andrew met her. It is also had very chilly green concrete floors and a broken window in her room. They often used the duck blanket to keep warm, and Andrew walked home during the sunrise from here to his house many times.

properties.name: Feliz's First San Diego Casa
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc7987 camino huerta, san diego, ca 92122This is the first place that Feliz has lived in San Diego, and probably the second to last one. She hopes that after this one she will get to move to Seattle with Andrew and live with a poofy puppy. Right now, she is practicing being in charge and also raising some houseplants.

properties.name: Feliz's Hi-Rise Apartment
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc2407 15th st, nw 20009It had a HUUUUUGE balcony. We watched lots of sunsets, grilled some contraband meat there, made sushi and watched fireworks ffrom the roof.

properties.name: Feliz's Mountain Stronghold
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc2201 s adams 80210Two dogs who really like Feliz live here. She takes them for walks in the mountains when she visits, and feeds them treats secretly.

properties.name: Following the blue car to California
properties.description: Posted by AndrewdcHeading through the mountains between Yuma, Arizona and San Diego. The blue car was nice, but slow. We had leave him in the dust.

properties.name: Great Falls Park
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc 9200 Old Dominion Dr, vaThis is where we come for a little bit of the real world when in DC.

properties.name: Jungle Town Where Feliz Worked
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdcveracruz, mexicoThis is where I worked and got a parasite. But it is very lush and mangoes fall from the trees.

properties.name: Los Bandidos de Carlos & Mickey's in El Paso
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc1310 Magruder El Paso, TX 79925Good food, bizarre atmosphere. Place felt vaguely shady -- how could it not, with that name? Interior was like the set of "Dusk \'Til Dawn". Definitely the highlight of the wasteland of El Paso, Texas.

properties.name: Pacific Beach at End of DC-San Diego Road Trip
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc  san diego californiaWe\'re done!

properties.name: Roadside vista between Dallas and Austin
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdchttp://maps.google.com/?ll=32.25912,-96.871262&spn=0.032081,0.05785&t=h"Okay, here\'s where we build the ranch..."

properties.name: Tax Foundation
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc2001 L street NW 20036Home of the true tax playas.

properties.name: Texas Hill Country west of Austin, Texas
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdcjohnson city, texasThe most beautiful place I\'ve ever seen, on the drive between Austin and Johnson "Home of LBJ" City, Texas. Changed my mind forever about Texas. It\'s awesome.

properties.name: Thaitanic
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc1236 14th St., NW Washington, DCDespite its thaipunniness, it has the best Thai food in town. I especially like to order things I that I have never tried before. Golden triangles!

properties.name: The Coldest Camping Trip So Far
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc  7206 National Seashore Lane, 21811I shudder to think that there may be colder ones in the future. But it was a good trip overall- we walked on the road that looked like a tunnel through the sky, saw the blown out coals on the dark beach, finally found clams that became a delicious stew and also managed to scare off a barbeque chip seeking pony.

properties.name: The Common Share
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc20009The notorious location of Andrew & Feliz\'s first date. Home of Red Stripe beer and D.C.\'s bizarre messenger-bag crowd. Classy!

properties.name: The Corner Pocket
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc98116West Seattle\'s finest dive bar.

properties.name: The Nicest Town Between Austin and San Diego
properties.description: Posted by AndrewdcYuma, AZYuma is the strangest place we found with great Indian food, and also was quite nice. I think it was the fact that my secret inner old lady and Andrew\'s secret old man liked the retirement community\'s amenities. Great desert sunsets too.

properties.name: The Skyline Drive in Shenandoah National Park
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc  luray, vaWe drove the first leg of the route from north to south, and exited here. There were copious butterflies and bikers, but they seemed to get along well. There were many green rolling hills and remains of some cabins.

properties.name: Tiny jungle town where Andrew once ate a monkey.
properties.description: Posted by AndrewdcIquitos, PeruTechnically, I was in the jungle about 300km north of there, up that river to the left. Note to self: next time, pass on the monkey.

properties.name: Welcome to Arkansas... NOOOOOOO!
properties.description: Posted by AndrewdcThe gates of Arkansas hell. Just hold your breath and keep driving. We\'re almost to Texas.

properties.name: Where we got soaked while walking home from wine-buying
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc2000 16th st nw, 20009We thought we could make it, and we couldn\'t. I had water running down my face, and this is where we gave up running because we were completely drenched. I was having a hard time running anyhow because I was laughing so hard. I don\'t even remember if we drank the wine....

properties.name: Ye Olde Cato Institute
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc1000 Massachusetts Ave NW Washington DCMeeting place of Andrew & Feliz, and home of the legendary email-ask-out. Key features include big windows, convenient parking, and nearness to D.C.\'s finest barbeque dive. Go Cato!
